thread.title: Another accumulator win for Soccerway's betting guide
thread.title_full: Another accumulator win for Soccerway's betting guide

title: Another accumulator win for Soccerway's betting guide
text:
Another accumulator win for Soccerway's betting guide Getty 0 Mar 20, 2017 10:09:30 The Soccerway team have regularly turned a profit with their selections and they picked out a 10/1 five fold in Edition 26 that had punters delighted 
Regular followers of the Soccerway weekly betting guide will know that the team have been tweaking and honing their betting approach and are now regularly producing a level stakes profit with most editions. 
While the majority of the stats-based picks are value angles and intended as single selections, there is a weekly fivefold for those readers who want to try for a bigger potential return over the weekend and Edition 26 saw a fantastic payout at 10/1 (11.0) , the highest priced winner to date! 
Consisting of picks from England, Spain and Italy, those who followed the recommended picks will be delighted to see the column produce a fourth winning multiple since getting underway earlier this season. 
There were half a dozen other correct tips too, with Bordeaux (21/20) consigning Montpellier to another defeat on the road in Ligue 1 while Napoli recorded another high-scoring victory, advised at 19/20 (1.95) . Had you backed each tip with a £10 stake then they'd you'd be over £75 up from the latest edition alone. 
Apart from the accumulator, the other winners came courtesy of Liverpool continuing their impressive record against the Premier League elite, securing a share of the spoils on the double chance market at 7/5 (2.40) . The team also highlighted Notts County's chances against Barnet and the home side duly obliged at 29/20 (2.45), winning 1-0. 
Once again the Anytime Angles column turned up a winner, as Koln's Anthony Modeste netted a hat-trick in his sides' clash with Hertha Berlin after our expert highlighted his free-scoring form. He was available at a huge 9/5 (2.80) to net anytime in that game. 
Every week there’s analysis of a number of statistical angles and betting markets so if you like your selections to be backed up by head-to-head records, recent form, goal time data or the latest facts from Opta, the Soccerway betting guide is definitely for you. 
Want to get the next round of selections which will cover all the international action? Simply register with Soccerway for free and get a copy delivered to your email inbox every time a new edition is available. If you want to see Edition 26, there’s also an option to download a copy from your Soccerway profile once logged into the site. Related
